00032 // Interface for the Error class
00033 //
00034 // jhrg 4/23/96
00035 
00036 #ifndef _error_h
00037 #define _error_h
00038 
00039 #ifndef __POWERPC__
00040 #ifdef __GNUG__
00041 #pragma interface
00042 #endif
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 #include <stdio.h>      // For FILE *
00046 
00047 #include <iostream>
00048 #include <string>
00049 
00050 using std::cout;
00051 using std::string;
00052 using std::ostream;
00053 
00059 typedef int ErrorCode; //using standard errno+netCDF error codes from server
00060 
00063 #define    undefined_error   1000 
00064 #define    unknown_error     1001 
00065 #define    internal_error    1002 
00066 #define    no_such_file      1003
00067 #define    no_such_variable  1004
00068 #define    malformed_expr    1005
00069 #define    no_authorization  1006
00070 #define    can_not_read_file 1007
00071 #define    cannot_read_file  1008
00072 
00073 
00075 enum ProgramType {
00076     undefined_prog_type = -1,
00077     no_program,         // if there is no program
00078     java,
00079     tcl
00080 };
00081 
00101 class Error {
00102 protected:
00103     ErrorCode _error_code;
00104     string _error_message;
00105     ProgramType _program_type;  
00106     char *_program;     
00107 
00108 public:
00110     Error(ErrorCode ec, string msg);
00112     Error(string msg);
00114     Error(ErrorCode ec, string msg, ProgramType pt, char *pgm);
00116     Error();
00117 
00119     Error(const Error &copy_from);
00120 
00121     virtual ~Error();
00122 
00123     Error &operator=(const Error &rhs);
00124 
00126     bool OK() const;
00128     bool parse(FILE *fp);
00130     void print(ostream &os = cout) const;
00132     void print(FILE *out) const;
00134     ErrorCode get_error_code() const;
00136     string get_error_message() const;
00138     ProgramType get_program_type() const;
00140     const char *get_program() const;
00142     void set_error_code(ErrorCode ec = undefined_error);
00144     void set_error_message(string msg = "");
00146     void set_program_type(ProgramType pt = undefined_prog_type);
00148     void set_program(char *program);
00150     void display_message(void *gui = 0) const;
00152     string correct_error(void *gui) const;
00154     string error_message(string msg = "");
00156     ProgramType program_type(ProgramType pt = undefined_prog_type);
00158     char *program(char *program = 0);
00160     ErrorCode error_code(ErrorCode ec = undefined_error);
00161 };

00224 // Revision 1.16  2000/09/21 16:22:07  jimg
00225 // Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00226 // Many methods that returned error codes now throw exceptions. There are
00227 // two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00228 // InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00229 // the library. Error is used to report all other errors. Since InternalErr
00230 // is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
00231 //
00232 // Revision 1.15  2000/07/09 21:57:09  rmorris
00233 // Mods's to increase portability, minimize ifdef's in win32 and account
00234 // for differences between the Standard C++ Library - most notably, the
00235 // iostream's.

00239 //
00240 // Revision 1.13.4.1  2000/06/02 18:21:26  rmorris

00242 //
00243 // Revision 1.13  2000/03/28 16:32:02  jimg
00244 // Modified these files so that they can be built either with and without GUI
00245 // defined. The type signatures are now the same either way. Thus we can
00246 // build libdap++-gui and libdap++ (without GUI support). When using the
00247 // later there's no need to link with tcl, tk or X11. This makes the
00248 // executables smaller. It also keeps the servers from potentially needing
00249 // sharable libraries (since X11 is often sharable) which can be hard to find
00250 // unless they are in the standard places. I made the same changes in Connect
00251 // and Gui.
00252 //

00256 // parameter list given that errors are now reported using exceptions.
